job_description: Data Analyst - Early Career - job post LOCKHEED MARTIN CORPORATION 9,160 reviews Fort Worth, TX 76137 Full-time, Part-time You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Job Type Full-time Part-time By bringing together people that use their passion for purposeful innovation, at Lockheed Martin we keep people safe and solve the world's most complex challenges. Our people are some of the greatest minds in the industry and truly make Lockheed Martin a great place to work. With our employees as our priority, we provide diverse career opportunities designed to propel development and boost agility. Our flexible schedules, competitive pay, and comprehensive benefits enable our employees to live a healthy, fulfilling life at and outside of work. At Lockheed Martin, we place an emphasis on empowering our employees by fostering innovation, integrity, and exemplifying the epitome of corporate responsibility. Your Mission is Ours. Lockheed Martin Aeronautics in Fort Worth, TX is seeking a full-time Early Career Data Analyst. In this role, you will perform Modeling/Simulation & Metric Analysis in support of F-35 Sustainment. You will support coordination and development of problem statements, modeling approaches and ground rules and assumptions (GR&A). You will also work under the guidance of a technical lead to perform analysis to establish a total cost to performance picture for Sustainment. The successful candidate will have experience and/or knowledge of modeling & simulation technical principles, concepts and techniques to assess Performance Based Logistics (PBL) metrics using commercial, government, and LM developed tools. Must be a US Citizen ; this position will require a government security clearance. This position is located at a facility that requires special access. Basic Qualifications: Bachelor of Science degree in Engineering or a related technical discipline (Industrial, Mechanical, Aerospace, Electrical, Etc); Physics, Data Science, Data Analysis, Physics, or Mathematics (use of stochastic and deterministic data models) or related technical disciplines with an emphasis in modeling, data manipulation, and/or the application of mathematical and statistical methods to apply to business and risk management problems. Must be a US Citizen ; this position will require a government security clearance. This position is located at a facility that requires special access. Desired Skills: Coursework or experience with/knowledge of conducting performance and cost analysis, Database systems (SQL and NO SQL based), Descriptive statistics and exploratory data analysis Predictive analytics – modeling, simulation and forecasting (for higher level employees), Statistical programming and data processing skills. Knowledge of scripting (one or more common languages e.g., Python and R), statistics (descriptive and inferential), data munging, and data visualization Experienced in data structures and hierarchies Experience collecting and compiling datasets from disparate data sources into the required data structure. Computer programming experience with SAS or other high-level language. Ability to query databases using Structured Query Language (SQL). Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau. Ability to perform analysis via multi-criteria decision modeling including discrete event simulations, statistical & risk analysis, life-cycle cost analysis, performance & cost trade-offs, and business case analysis Proficiency with MS Office tool suite. Experience managing data quality and configuration control. Coursework or previous experience analyzing supply chain networks. Strong analytical skills and understanding of system databases, data elements and application software solutions to optimize data gathering and analysis Excellent written and verbal communication skills Ability to work in a collaborative and team-based environment Security Clearance Statement: This position requires a government security clearance, you must be a US Citizen for consideration. Clearance Level: Secret Other Important Information You Should Know Expression of Interest: By applying to this job, you are expressing interest in this position and could be considered for other career opportunities where similar skills and requirements have been identified as a match. Should this match be identified you may be contacted for this and future openings. Ability to Work Remotely: Part-time Remote Telework: The employee selected for this position will work part of their work schedule remotely and part of their work schedule at a designated Lockheed Martin facility. The specific weekly schedule will be discussed during the hiring process. Work Schedules: Lockheed Martin supports a variety of alternate work schedules that provide additional flexibility to our employees. Schedules range from standard 40 hours over a five day work week while others may be condensed. These condensed schedules provide employees with additional time away from the office and are in addition to our Paid Time off benefits. Schedule for this Position: 4x10 hour day, 3 days off per week Lockheed Martin is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status. As a leading technology innovation company, Lockheed Martin’s vast team works with partners around the world to bring proven performance to our customers’ toughest challenges. Lockheed Martin has employees based in many states throughout the U.S., and Internationally, with business locations in many nations and territories. Lockheed Martin Aeronautics in Fort Worth, Texas is seeking a full-time Early Career Data Science / Data Analyst. In this role, you will support the Data Quality & Integration Management (DQIM) organization in support of Lockheed Martin Aeronautics Sustainment. We are seeking world-class talent to apply technical standards, principles, theories, concepts, and techniques in the data quality engineering discipline to resolve complex problems. The candidate must be able to concurrently handle multiple and widely varying assignments in a fast-paced, ever-changing environment. Must have the ability to work independently as well as being a team-player and willing to support other team members on a proactive basis Must engage professionally and effectively with senior management Must be able to successfully meet deadlines and execute to a strict timeline The successful candidate will have experience and/or knowledge of Bachelor of Science Degree in Engineering or a related technical discipline: Industrial, Mechanical, Aerospace, Electrical, Data Science, Data Analysis, Physics or Mathematics (use of stochastic and deterministic data models) or related technical disciplines with an emphasis on modeling, data manipulation, and/or the application of mathematical and statistical methods. Experience working to integrate and deliver data and provide data forensics/analysis Techniques in data analysis, data extraction, data mining. Manipulation of data using Microsoft Excel and/or Access Coursework or experience using databases and/or visualizations (MS Access, Tableau, SQL/Oracle Coursework or experience in formal presentation development, PowerPoint construct and delivery Must be a US Citizen. This position will require a government security clearance. This position is located at a facility that requires special access. Basic Qualifications: Bachelor of Science Degree in Engineering or a related Technical discipline: Industrial, Computer, Mechanical, Aerospace, Electrical, Data Science, Data Analysis, Physics or Mathematics Experience working to integrate and deliver data and provide data forensics/analysis Techniques in data analysis, data extraction, data mining Manipulation of data using Microsoft Excel and/or Access Coursework or experience using databases and/or visualizations (MS Access, Tableau, SQL/Oracle Coursework or experience in formal presentation development, PowerPoint construct and delivery Must be a US Citizen. This position will require a government security clearance. This position is located at a facility that requires special access. Desired Skills: Experience in one or more of the following: Use of TeamCenter (PDM/LDM) to review and verify Design and Logistics Data First-hand experience using F-35 ATLAS application to extract and verify logistics data MS Project / scheduling tools MS Access DB Development- Development of Aircraft/Aviation System Bills-of-Material (BOM)/Structures Reading, Writing, and Applying Structured Query Language (SQL) to extract, process and manipulate data Reading, Interpreting, and Writing eXtensible Markup Language (XML) Systems Engineering Principles to include requirements Hands-on knowledge with TeamCenter e-Cubed report builder MS Access DB Development- Outstanding interpersonal, communication, and problem solving skills with the ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously. Security Clearance Statement: This position requires a government security clearance, you must be a US Citizen for consideration. Risk Integrator - Data Analyst, Level 4 - job post LOCKHEED MARTIN CORPORATION 9,160 reviews Fort Worth, TX 76137 Full-time, Part-time You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Job Type Full-time Part-time At Lockheed Martin Aeronautics, we're taking innovation to the next level. From designing the most advanced air vehicle to designing aircraft that defies gravity, our engineers live on the cutting edge of technology. Never have the opportunities for a technical career been so limitless. The Supply Chain Management organization (SCM) is looking for a strong, self-motivated individual to join the Risk Management team within the Supplier Performance department. This candidate will support the Risk, Issue and Opportunity (RIO) team as a data analyst to assist in solving challenging data analytics, reporting, modeling, and visualization problems as well as working as a risk integrator to ensure that SCM risks are documented, tracked and mitigated to closure. The candidate will utilize a vast array of supplier performance related data sets to identify opportunities to analytically modernize pre-existing processes and introduce new and creative ways to utilize risk management data. This will include data architecture processes and database and server management skill sets as well as web development skill sets. The candidate will also use risk tools for early identification of risk and implement mitigation planning and develop improvement plans as required. The candidate will oversee the documentation of risks in the SCM risk register tools to ensure risks are tracked for closure. The expectation is to evaluate risk, issue and opportunity items with critical thinking to make recommendations to resolve any RIO items brought forward for resolution. The candidate will collaboratively work with multiple functions and organizations with SCM to assist in data extractions, reports and automation. This will require the basic knowledge and experience with Python and VBA/Excel Macro automations. Candidate will also need to have the skills and abilities to complete the individual tasks and projects assigned and communicate status to the team and various levels of leadership. The candidate will also prepare industry risk analysis including commodity assessments, financial risk investigations, white papers and status for PowerPoint presentations to management. The candidate will also participate as a contributor to the monthly Risk Management Board reviews. This position is located at a facility that requires special access. AeroSCM Basic Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university Experience in supply chain, production operations, or manufacturing Experience in data analytics, data engineering, and/or data science Advanced in Tableau and Tableau Prep Desired Skills: Experience with Python, MS, SQL Server, AWS, Git, Linux and Server Administration Experience using risk tools and resources to track and document risk items Experience identifying risk, issue and opportunities in the supply chain environment Supply chain experience working supplier recovery/improvement plans Experience with ASP.NET, JavaScript, HTML, and CSS Experience leading and implementing continuous improvement activities Experience with thinking strategically, at an enterprise level A focus on continuous improvement Clearance Level: None Other Important Information You Should Know Expression of Interest: By applying to this job, you are expressing interest in this position and could be considered for other career opportunities where similar skills and requirements have been identified as a match. Should this match be identified you may be contacted for this and future openings. Schedules range from standard 40 hours over a five day work week while others may be condensed. These condensed schedules provide employees with additional time away from the office and are in addition to our Paid Time off benefits.
